author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Four workers injured as hanger collapses at Newark Airport - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Four workers injured as hanger collapses at Newark Airport Published on : Thursday, September 10, 2015
A hangar at the Newark Liberty International Airport which was already set for demolition collapsed. Four out of nine workers were injured as they were working inside the hanger.
The workers who were carrying out the demolition were working on the ground floor and second floor when the metal building collapsed.
The injured four workers were transported to the hospital. The injuries were not life threatening and included facial lacerations and a leg injury.
The hangar was not in use since a decade, it was previously owned by United Airlines. No airplane was kept inside and the metal building was mostly used for storage. It is owned by the port authority of New York and New Jersey which also runs this airport.
